resources.string:
Scientific name :- Rasboroides pallidus

\n
  • Family :- Cyprinidae
  • English name :- Pallid Rasbora
  • Sinhala name :- Panduwan Halmal dandiya
  • IUCN Status :- Local (2012): NE
    Global (2018):

• Location :- Found in Kalu to Nilwala river basins
  • Environment :- Found in shallow, slow-flowing, densely shaded lowland rain-foconted streams with a sandy-silt substrate
  • Maximum length :- Can be grow up to 24.6cm
  • Identification features :-
    Males have same color unbranched rays on dorsal, anal, pectoral and pelvic fins.

    Females have greater body depth

    Origin of pelvic fin slightly anterior to vertical through origin of dorsal fin
  • Other :- N/A

Scientific name :- Pethiya reval

\n
  • Family :- Cyprinidae
  • English name :- Sri Lanka Red-fined Barb
  • Sinhala name :- Rathuwaral depulliya
  • IUCN Status :- Local (2012): EN
    Global (2018):

• Location :- Found in Kelani to Kalu river basins
  • Environment :- Found in flowing or still, clear streams with a sandy-muddy substrate
  • Maximum length :- Can be grow up to 3cm
  • Identification features :-
    • Dorsal, anal, and pelvic fins are red

    Two elongated blotches
  • Other :- N/A

Scientific name :- Devario malabaricus

\n
  • Family :- Cyprinidae
  • English name :- Giant Danio
  • Sinhala name :- Damkola saalaya
  • IUCN Status :- Local (2012): LC
    Global (2018):

• Location :- Found in wet, dry and intermediate zones
  • Environment :- Found in variety of habitats from small streams to tanks with clear or murky water
  • Maximum length :- Can be grow up to 8cm
  • Identification features :-
    • P stripe anteriorly divided P, P+1 and P-1 stripes pconent anterior to caudal peduncle
  • Other :- N/A

Scientific name :- Dawkinsia singhala

\n
  • Family :- Cyprinidae
  • English name :- Sri Lanka Filamented Barb
  • Sinhala name :- Damkola pethiya
  • IUCN Status :- Local (2012): LC
    Global (2018):

• Location :- Found in wet, dry and intermediate zones
  • Environment :- Found in variety of habitats from fast/slow flowing streams to tanks
  • Maximum length :- Can be grow up to 7-8cm
  • Identification features :-
    no distinct marks on caudal fin lobes or on body in advance of anal fin origin
  • Other :-
    Filamentous dorsal fin with elongated rays are absent in females

    Juveniles have 3 black bands on body which fade with maturity (Except band above anal fin)

Scientific name :- Lepidocephalichthys thermalis

\n
  • Family :- Cobitidae
  • English name :- Common Spiny Loach
  • Sinhala name :- Ahirava, Wairan ahirava
  • IUCN Status :- Local (2012): CR
    Global (2018):

• Location :- Found in wet, dry and intermediate zones
  • Environment :- Found in variety of habitats from streams to tanks, lagoons and canals
  • Maximum length :- Can be grow up to 5cm
  • Identification features :-
    Truncate/rounded caudal fin

    No scales on top of the head

    3-5 board dark bars on the caudal fins
  • Other :-
    • Males have slender body with darker colors

    Females are little lager than male

Scientific name :- Pseudosphromenus cupanus

\n
  • Family :- Belontidae
  • English name :- Spike Tailed Paradise Fish
  • Sinhala name :- Pulutta
  • IUCN Status :- Local (2012): LC
    Global (2018):

• Location :- Found in wet zones
  • Environment :- Found in still water habitats
  • Maximum length :- Can be grow up to 8cm
  • Identification features :-
    Adult males have extended dorsal, anal and caudal fins

    First rays of pelvic fins and center ray of caudal fin elongated with a filament
  • Other :- Females and juveniles are darken in color with shorter filaments
